document.docAuthor: Niu, Ze-Qing, Yuan, Feng, Ascher, John S., Kasparek, Max, Orr, Michael C., Griswold, Terry & Zhu, Chao-Dong
document.masterDocTitle: Bees of the genus Anthidium Fabricius, 1804 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Megachilidae: Anthidiini) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Bees of the genus Anthidium Fabricius, 1804 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Megachilidae: Anthidiini) from China

subSubSection.paragraph: ( Fig. 37 a–h, female; Fig. 38 a–j, male)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Anthidium ( Proanthidium ) oblongatum Latreille, 1809
:
Wu, 2006: 166
, ♀ (key), ♂ (key), 169, ♀ , ♂ (redescription), Fig. 90. (misidentification, erroneous nomenclator and original publication date).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis: This species is very similar to
Anthidium ( Proanthidium ) oblongatum ( Latreille, 1809 )
and can be distinguished from
A. ( P. ) oblongatum
by the following combination of characters: female F1 about 2.0X as long as broad ( Fig. 37d ), male F1 about 1.8X as long as broad ( Fig. 38c ), anterior surface of the male F1–F2 and the female F2–F4 reddish-brown, propodeal triangle with dense punctures, apical process of male S8 sub-triangular and rounded apically ( Fig. 38h ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 37.
Anthidium ( Proanthidium ) kashgarense ( Cockerell, 1911 )
. Female. a: Body in lateral view; b: Head in frontal view; c: Clypeus in frontal view; d: Flagellum in ventral view; e: Mandible in lateral view; f: Mesosoma in dorsal view; g: Metasoma in dorsal view; h: T4–T6 in dorsal view. Scale bars: 1 mm.

FIGURE 38.
Anthidium ( Proanthidium ) kashgarense ( Cockerell, 1911 )
. Male. a: Body in lateral view; b: head in frontal view; c: Flagellum in ventral view; d (d-1Mesosoma in dorsal view, d-1 showing the scutellum with narrow yellow apical margin; e: Metasoma in dorsal view; f: T6–T7 in dorsal view; g: S6 in ventral view; h: S8 in ventral view; i: Genitalia in dorsal view; j: Hind trochanter in ventral view, showing the subapical inside projection. Scale bars: 1 mm.

Type locality. China
: Xinjiang Uygur : Kashgar
.
Distribution: China ( Hebei , Inner Mongolia , Xinjiang ).

Remarks: The male is described for the first time here. Wu (2006) misidentified some female specimens as
A. ( P. ) oblongatum ( Latreille, 1809 )
, but the female F1 is about 2.0X as long as broad ( Fig. 37d ), the male F1 is about 1.8X as long as broad ( Fig. 38c ), the anterior surface of the male F1–F2 and the female F2–F4 are reddish-brown, propodeal triangle with dense punctures, apical process of male S8 is sub-triangular and rounded apically ( Fig. 38h ), and these characters separate this species from
A. ( P. ) oblongatum ( Illiger, 1806 )
(F1 of female and male about 1.4X as long as broad, the color of flegellomere is black, propodeal triangle of female shiny, nearly smooth, apical process of male S8 subquadrate, truncate apically). Consequently,
A. ( P. ) oblongatum ( Illiger, 1806 )
does not currently occur in China , although Ebmer (2010) thought it occurs in Xinjiang of China .
